metadata.title: CVE-2021-20193 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the src/list.c of tar 1.33 and earlier. This flawallows an attacker who can submit a crafted input file to tar to causeuncontrolled consumption of memory. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
tar-scripts - 1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tar package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.27.1-1ubuntu0.1+esm2').
